summary: This document is a series of emails from June-July 2020 between a NYPD/FBI detective and an FBI SSA regarding travel approval for an operation to arrest a target in the Epstein investigation in Massachusetts. It details expense estimates and adjustments for a four-person team.

persons.name: Detective
persons.role: NYPD / FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force Detective
persons.context: The primary author requesting travel approval to arrest a target in the Epstein investigation in Massachusetts. They provide expense estimates and updates on the travel dates.

persons.name: SSA
persons.role: Supervisory Special Agent, Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking Unit
persons.context: The approving official for the travel request. They authorize the use of a specific operational travel EAN number.

connections.description: The Detective requests and the SSA approves operational travel for an arrest mission related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Travel for Arrest Operation
events.description: A four-person law enforcement team travels to Massachusetts to arrest a target in the Epstein investigation, with the possibility of escorting the target back to New York.

events.title: Travel Request Submitted
events.description: A detective submits a formal email request for travel approval to arrest a target in the Epstein investigation believed to be in Massachusetts.

events.title: Travel Approval and Expense Update
events.description: The SSA approves the travel request, and the detective provides a corrected expense total after the mission was completed from June 30 to July 2.

keyFacts: In late June/early July 2020, a joint NYPD/FBI task force was actively pursuing the arrest of a target in the Epstein investigation.
The target was believed to be located in Massachusetts, and a four-person team planned to drive there, possibly escorting the target back to New York.
The operation involved the FBI's Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking Unit (CACHTU) and used specific operational travel funding (EAN 564339.1).
The travel dates were adjusted, with the team ultimately traveling from June 30 to July 2, 2020.
The document demonstrates ongoing investigative activity related to the Epstein case years after his death.
